attributes.action: Allow children to start school at 4
attributes.background: I have been told that my 3 year old will have to wait until he is 5 before he starts main stream school because his birthday is September(After June). Why can't children start when they are 4 or start them according to their learning and only hold them back if they need the extra help
attributes.additional_details: I personally would much rather my son have an extra year at school than an extra year in nursery.

attributes.action: Black Ancient History to be taught in schools. As a course, module, in all level
attributes.background: In school the only recollection of any study about Africa, was based upon African colonisation, and pro independence; this was fine, until I started to come across information about African Ancient History post university, by myself, with the help of the internet. I felt overwhelmed and shocked.
attributes.additional_details:
I did Politics and International Relations Degree.

Nevertheless missing African Ancient history is like missing a huge chunk of world history.

If the following is included in the educational system, it would be great. Information about.....

- Nubia



- Songhai

- Lost African Kings and Queens such  as: Nefertiti, Sheba, Hannibal

- Kemet

- Ashanti

- Moors (when blacks ruled Spain)

 -Benin Empire(1180-1897 CE) , Mali Empire (1235-1600 CE) , Ghana Empire (700-1240 CE)

+ more

attributes.action: Full-time employees to receive £100 bonus a month if they have no sickness
attributes.background: People who work full time, pay bills, have no help and have little left per month should be rewarded with a £100 incentive. This would make people working full time feel appreciated. The Government are helping the wrong people and its time for full-time workers to have a reward.

attributes.action: "PAMPER ON PRESCRIPTION" -  health professionals to prescribe holistic therapies
attributes.background: This idea could potentially save the NHS £millions.  As a sufferer from Mental Health issues I have often felt the need for relaxation to aid my stress levels, and have personal experience that even basic massage is the best relaxant and stress reliever ***(Please read 'more details' section)***
attributes.additional_details: The massage itself works wonders, but the talking that accompanies the treatment is also very therapeutic.  e.g. a simple hand massage.  To pay for these treatments can be relatively costly for me, but if I could access the therapies regularly, I would be able to cut down on expensive medication, thereby saving the NHS money.  I can advocate this idea as I know it works.

attributes.action: I want to start a petition to ban fixed odds betting machines in all book makers
attributes.background: I want to ban all fixed odd gaming machine in all bookmakers. I think these machines exploit people and the human brain, these bookmakers spend thousands of pounds in doing this. People have ruined thier own lives and people around them lives by playing these highly addictive machines.

attributes.action: Introduce a separate, higher minimum wage for temporary workers and agency staff
attributes.background:
This petition is to help address the issue of unstable employment in our economy and to help promote the concerns about zero hour and temporary contracts. 
If temporary workers were given a higher minimum wage then this could encourage employers to offer permanent contracts and reduce exploitation.

attributes.action: Make all healthcare assistants registered and Band 3/4
attributes.background: Healthcare assistants are forefront in hospitals, care homes and many other places. Some healthcares have been working in the profession for 10years or more yet we are not reconigsed. We simply just known as 'just a healthcare assistant'
attributes.additional_details:
Help us get registered and recognised for what we do on Band 3/4
Healthcare assistants are not just bed bath washers or dinner deliverers.
We do bloods, cannultion, blood pressures, blood sugars,vaccines i.e flu vaccines, wound care along with patient personal care and comfort. 
For what we do in our job role we do not get the recongition like we should and to be on band 2 where secretaries are band 4 is unfair.

attributes.action: Ban the use of video interviews using computer analysis to select candidates
attributes.background: Many companies have began using video interviews in their application process. These interviews are reviewed by a computer and never seen by a person. The algorithms used cannot account for behavioural differences exhibited by people with disabilities and so, it removes them as viable candidates.
attributes.additional_details: Video interview algorithms are set up to analyses both verbal and non-verbal communication. The main problem with this system is that the characteristics which are deemed to be ‘good’ are generally characteristics which people with learning difficulties, such as ADHD or Aspergers will never display under the circumstances of a video interview. In an actual face to face interview, the interviewer can understand and account for the difference in communication while an algorithm cannot.

attributes.action: Stop Dartford toll fees.
attributes.background: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

attributes.action: UK referendum on the free movement of people from European Union countries.
attributes.background:
A referendum on free movement of people from the European Union is essential. 
 Let the country decide who can come here, with a simple yes or no referendum.

attributes.action: Put a tax on fish so fish can flourish more in the ocean.
attributes.background: Over fishing is declining fishes numbers so if there were a tax on buying them fishing would decline and the government would get more money.

attributes.action: Change PE back to 60% practical 40% theory
attributes.background: If it’s called physical education, why is there more theory then practical?

attributes.action: Devolve Corporation Tax to the Scottish Parliament
attributes.background: We want lower taxes for businesses in Scotland, which probably means lower corporation tax rather than lower income tax. So now, I call on the UK government to devolve corporation tax.
attributes.additional_details: If the Scottish Parliament had the power to set corporation tax at a lower rate, then it would encourage more businesses to move up to Scotland. In my opinion, this would probably suit a lot of businesses. And I would also call on all parties at Westminster to work together to achieve this.

attributes.action: Restrict how soon shops, supermarkets can put out for sale Easter products.
attributes.background: This is destroying the spirit of Christmas and Easter as they are becoming one event. There should be a restriction that prevents shops from doing this, eg a time restriction of for example 8 weeks before Easter.
attributes.additional_details: Walking around my local Tesco supermarket on the 4th January I was confronted with Easter chocolates for sale (and we're talking proper Easter eggs, not just small cream eggs) I also understand some retailers had Easter out on New Years day. This is wrong and erodes the meaning of these events as they are becoming like the sales, an event that happens every day. It is not good for children to see things available so quickly as this does not teach them anything about the significance of the day.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax allowance discrepancy between UK worker & Tier2  employee
attributes.background:
A UK worker receives no taxfree allowance for paying utility bills, rent or council tax. Also, pays compulsory NI. 
A seconded worker under Tier2 Inter-Company Transfer scheme gets tax free allowance for paying utility bills, rents & council tax under Dispensation model plus optional NI for 2 years
attributes.additional_details:
ICT worker with £40,000 annual salary receives 20-40% of salary (£700-£1200 per month) as tax free allowance. 
E.g. Gross Pay=£40,000
Annual Income tax paid by ICT worker is £2,818.20
UK worker pays £9,518.52 
A normal UK worker pays 3 times the tax paid by a person on Tier2 seconded employee. Can government explain the reason behind this discrimination between UK & Non-UK employed person?  
Can government and HMRC explain what are the benefits of this system to the Great Britain & wider public?

attributes.action: Allow people with amblyopia, also known as lazy eye to join armed forces
attributes.background: Ever since i was young i have wanted to join the armed forces and recently attempted to with the royal air force and was turned down at the medical stage, the problem? my eyesight in just one eye! I Don't see how having one bad eye can stop me from being a chef in the RAF
attributes.additional_details: Please change eyeseight rules and open doors for the many people suffering from Amblyopia.

attributes.action: Make it law that all shops have adequate cctv coverage.
attributes.background:
I had my phone stolen in a store in Westfield & this store did not have cctv. 
If cctv had been available, security could have checked to see if the offender was still in the area.
I'm sure I'm not the only person to experience this, nor the frustration that follows.

attributes.action: Require all car manufactures to offer retrofitting of L.E.D DRL
attributes.background:
I acknowledge that it is now a legal requirement for new cars to be fitted with DRL, however older vehicles can be retrofitted with them as they have a lot of benefits.
The point of the petition is to make it a legal requirement for all car manufactures to offer retrofitting LED DRL's
attributes.additional_details:
In the research conducted by the European Commision in 2006 it has been confirmed that they have potential in reducing road deaths due to making the vehicle more visible to other road users during the day and are then switched off when sidelights/dipped lights are switched on. 

Third party retrofitting systems are available but are not very reliable, hence why I wish all car manufactures to offer LED DRL's that would be installed by the manufacturer themselves.

attributes.action: Fund a student railway discount card to lower costs
attributes.background: I am 17 years old, and I have to pay £6.70 a day to just get to school. This isn’t even including the cost of getting home. Why should I have to pay such an extortionate amount of money to go somewhere that I have to be by law?

attributes.action: Protect against big business interests with a “People’s” lobby group fund
attributes.background: The government should change the law to impose a 10% tax on all payments to lobbying organisations.  The tax receipts could be used to establish and fund a public taxpayer interest group which would review all lobbying activities and participate and publicly report on each policy decision change.
attributes.additional_details:
The democratic system is systematically undermined every day by individuals, corporations and organizations who act to influence the actions, policies and decisions of government officers on their own behalf or for a selected group’s personal advantage or gain to the exclusion of the majority.

It is important for government officials and MPs serve the public interest first and not get mislead by lobbying parties or advisors who inadvertently act in a lobbying capacity.

attributes.action: Safeguard public funds with full annual NAO risk audit on all outsourcers
attributes.background: The Government should change the law so that the NAO is given responsibly for auditing any company that wins Government contract worth more than £20 million and that any appropriate contract must include an agreement to be audited by the NAO and the results made public.
attributes.additional_details: As illustrated by Carillion and numerous other major corporate failures before it, the ‘Big Four’ independent audit opinion has been confirmed as inherently flawed.  There is an inherent risk in the ‘Big Four’ conducting annual audits of companies where senior management are ex-‘Big Four’ themselves.  A mutual understanding serves each party in this situation as well as the knowledge that any moral hazard contracts or companies are ultimately backed by the government and UK taxpayers.

attributes.action: End any form of Monarchy in the UK and end all payments to the Royal Family.
attributes.background: Considering the financial state of the UK and with costs being cut left, right and centre is it perhaps time we cut one of the largest expenses? The Queen receives a HUGE payment from the tax payers of the United Kingdom on top of profits made from her own private lands. Both in the millions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Royal Family spend millions on travel, renovations and many luxuries. These costs don't include the hiring of security, among other things such as Royal Weddings. 
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2017/jun/27/queens-income-rises-to-82m-to-cover-cost-of-buckingham-palace-works
https://www.coventrytelegraph.net/news/coventry-news/how-much-royal-family-cost-14111218

attributes.action: Ban hunting for pheasants and other game birds. It is very cruel.
attributes.background: Hunting pheasants is just as bad as fox hunting in my opinion. This is a very very cruel sport. The poor birds are treated very badly and this needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: There are many videos on YouTube which show how these poor birds suffer. Why? All for the entertainment of huntsmen. How would they feel? To be shot and left for dead?

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to use lies as part of a campaign for a public vote
attributes.background: The use of lies in public campaigns is  growing

attributes.action: Continue benefit payments while processing Universal Credit
attributes.background: UC is the total of all benefits that a person will claim. Once UC has been processed, and the amount payable is known, then deduct or add accordingly HB/CT/ESA etc. with the remainder being the claimant's entitlement. This will prevent risking lives/ homes or the need for food banks in the meantime.

attributes.action: Debate diesel prices and car tax
attributes.background: Diesel prices: we were encouraged to buy a diesel car and now diesel prices and car tax are going up (and the roads are full of potholes). Electric cars are no good for towing and you have to sit about in services for a hour to recharge them.

attributes.action: Increase British military spending to £65 Billion
attributes.background: The UK’s military spending is way to low with the threats in N.Korea, Syria and Russia we need to increase spending please sign this petition to increase military spending

attributes.action: Force all local councils to offer a dedicated plastic waste bin
attributes.background: In the wake of the current plastic crisis I find it staggering that there are still councils like mine in Swindon that do not provide people with a dedicated plastic waste bin.
attributes.additional_details: For example in Swindon if we wish to recycle plastic we have to buy white bin bags and then the waste will be collected. No it doesn't cost much but it is obviously enough to put people off and that is evident every bin collection day. So while the government think about what the consumer can do to help the issue with plastic bottle return points, I think they need to also look at what they should be doing and this is a simple step already offered by other councils.

attributes.action: Abolish prohibited lanes for HGV overtaking on M11 and A14.
attributes.background: These stretches of the M11 and A14 where overtaking for HGV’s is prohibited are completely counter productive. They serve to prevent HGV’s overtaking for long periods and inconveniencing other road users.
attributes.additional_details: In reality these lanes create long tailbacks as faster/unladen HGV’s have to queue behind other slower/laden vehicles uphill with reduced speeds of sometimes 25-30mph. When the restriction ends all the faster HGV’s accerlerate pull out into lane 2 to overtake. These lanes are a complete false economy and are dangerous.

attributes.action: British Army only to be used overseas at the request of a Sovereign Government.
attributes.background: No more Invasions, No more innocents suffering for greed and power, No more fighting 'Rebels',trained,funded and supplied by our weapons and the weapons of our allies.
attributes.additional_details: History

attributes.action: Fund “Off The Street, Less Heat” youth project and similar projects
attributes.background: Off the Street, Less Heat is a youth diversion project which provides sports and other workshops to distract young people from anti-social behaviour, gang-related violence and street crime. Due to Government cuts, it and projects like it have lost funding.
attributes.additional_details: Off the Street, Less Heat was started in 2006/07 by Elaine Roberts, who came up with the name and idea, to help get young people off the streets and welcome people from all different communities. The project also aims to improve the relations between the police and the local community. Off the Street, Less Heat and similar projects all over the country need direct funding from the Government to ensure that they can continue.

attributes.action: Add 1p Income Tax & Reduce Aid to OECD average to create a BREXIT readiness fund
attributes.background: I believe the majority of British People support Foreign Aid spending but feel we are spending a bit too much currently. I also believe our Country is in need of Strategic Infrastructure and Business Support Spending to help us during the pre Brexit and immediate post Brexit period.

attributes.action: Raise the legal age to 25 for buying knives or blades of any type.
attributes.background: Children as young as 14 are carrying & using knives to harm others.The current age of 18 yrs is clearly not enough. Not everyone will adhere to a knife amnesty, nor will stop and search reach all.Raise the legal age to 25.Make it harder for them to obtain in the first place so less knives on streets

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.

attributes.action: Allow fast food delivery drivers access to bus lanes during operating hours.
attributes.background: As the majority of bus lanes restrict public traffic from travelling along them between 7am-7pm, a lot of fast food takeaways deliver within these hours and delivery drivers are commonly stuck in traffic during rush hour. This results in orders arriving late, negative customer reviews etc.
attributes.additional_details: A simple suggestion to put this into perspective would be to allow employers to distribute e.g. Plates, stickers to their employees vehicles to easily identify that they are eligible and to also prevent the misuse of bus lanes.

attributes.action: large vehicle awareness a mandatory part of obtaining a small vehicle licence
attributes.background: I feel that not enough people driving small vehicles are educated about the dangers of sharing the road with Heavy goods vehicles, Dangerous goods and long loads pose a threat to life if the proper information hasn't been given to all including those who are simply sharing the road.
attributes.additional_details: All I am asking is for people to be taught about what the signs mean on trucks that are designed to warn other road users of the dangers the vehicle poses. And for potential car licence holders to be educated on stopping times and blind spots of different vehicles. 75% of accidents between HGVs and cars are the car drivers fault and being given more awareness as part of a small vehicle licence could drastically improve those figures and even save lives!

attributes.action: Introduce Religious Studies/ REPS as an EBacc humanity subject
attributes.background: So many of us at our school have been restricted due to being forced to do EBacc. We only get given 4 choices, 2 of which have to be a language or a humanity, either history or geography. Many students want to do RS but cannot due to limited options.
attributes.additional_details: Religious, Ethical and Philosophical Studies (REPS) is an academically challenging subject that it much more interesting and useful for many school students than History or Geography. It encourages debate and gives us the freedom to express our views. It also improves essay writing skills important to other GCSEs such as English, further developing us there, and gives us the knowledge and ability to discuss current affairs and issues, in addition to past issues like history.

attributes.action: Do not make any changes to the current devolution arrangements
attributes.background: In 1997, the people of Scotland voted very decisively to have a devolved Scottish Parliament and devolved powers as well, and they are within an EU framework. But now, the UK government is planning a ‘power grab’ on these areas such as agriculture, farming and fishing.
attributes.additional_details: So I call on the UK government not to change the current devolution settlement. They say it will be more expensive to have different sets of rules, but I don’t agree with them. If they want a UK-wide framework, then maybe they could look towards having a federalised framework rather than a ‘power grab’.

attributes.action: 5 year driving ban for speads in excess of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.background: A driver who speeds excessively is aware of their actions. Therefore an immediate ban of 5years should be given to those driving in excess  of 10mph over the specified limit.
attributes.additional_details: Many people are killed each year by speeding drivers. If those drivers were told if they speed more than 10mph over the specified limit they would be banned from driving for 5 years. We would have a lot of people asking themselves is it rely worth the risk of 5 year  instant ban.

attributes.action: Increase the expenditure of money on prisons.
attributes.background: The prison system hasn't been correctly funded or managed for years. We propose that the government spends more of its expenditure on the prison system to increase capacity and pursue its purpose.

attributes.action: Start a British Foreign Legion.
attributes.background: Many British Army applicants are turned away due to their history of mental illness, certain complications such as having had a detached retina and also those with a criminal background. However The French Foreign legion could accept these failed applicants and they often prove to be great recruits.
attributes.additional_details:
So I ask that a British Foreign Legion is formed so Patriots of this country who were rejected by the British Army can serve their country, as I believe it is wrong that many patriots like my self are not given this opportunity, due to their pasts.
Just like the French Foreign legion, people who want to come to this country to make a better life for themselves could do so by serving five years in the British Foreign legion. After that time is served they can be granted British citizenship.

attributes.action: Get Michael Gove to maintain farming subsidies after Brexit.
attributes.background: Under current EU legislation farmers in the UK receive 3 billion pounds year in subsidies mostly in basic payments which are based on per acre owned of land.
attributes.additional_details:
Michael Gove the environment secretary has pledged post Brexit to maintain the basic payments for most farmers for a transition period only. He is in the meantime reviewing several options to cap the payments and introduce progressive reductions.

The petition is to maintain the payments to the farmers.

British Farming employs 3.8 million people and is a business worth 109 billion. The idea of the petition is to educate the public about the value British farming has on the country and ask for their support by signing a petition to lobby their MP’s to support continuing subsidies for British farmers.

attributes.action: Hold a Northern Ireland referendum on whether to Remain in the EU Customs Union
attributes.background: Northern Ireland voted by a significant majority to Remain in the EU and will be one of the regions most significantly affected by withdrawal. As Sinn Fein do not take up their seats in Parliament, it would be good to go directly to the NI electorate for their views on this proposal.

attributes.action: Stop 'Treatment Without Consent' in the Mental Health Act
attributes.background: If patients with physical illnesses such as cancer can refuse treatment mental health patients should also be able to do the same. The current practice of using the Mental Health Act to force treatment is coercive and a violation of the autonomy of the patient.
attributes.additional_details: The current practice of psychiatry is almost exclusively based on a biochemical model. The outcome of this is that medication is seen as the only credible resort when treating patients suffering from psychotic illness. When patients suffer side effects they are seen as non-compliant and when they stop medication they are placed on CTOs. This violates the patient's autonomy to make decisions for themselves about their treatment.

attributes.action: Reduce preventable negligence cases within the NHS
attributes.background: Thousands of patients are being let down by avoidable errors made by the NHS. Errors such as failing to provide emergency care, mistakes in dispensing the correct drugs and dosages, misdiagnosis, delays in treatment, and incorrect treatment. This is harming patients and causing unnecessary deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last decade, negligence claims against the NHS have quadrupled to an annual payout of £1.7 billion. This is set to double by 2021. This suggests a growing problem that isn't being dealt with effectively. Health leaders propose to address this issue by capping the amount of compensation that is paid out to victims. Yet this won't reduce the number of negligence cases. We need to invest more resources into identifying the root causes of the problem and in turn implementing a solution.

attributes.action: Ban nudity on social media
attributes.background: Nudity has a negative affect on society, and vulnerable individuals are pressured into posting provocative images online which will stay there forever. Naked pictures online causes harm to future generations, because children may feel ‘not good enough’ when compared to the images online.
attributes.additional_details: Instagram and YouTube are full of inappropriate material that shouldn’t be uploaded in the first place.

attributes.action: Allow IVF medication to be donated or sold through appropriate channels.
attributes.background: IVF medication is extremely expensive and is very often left over in large quantities due to miscalculation or like in my case because the treatment didn’t work. I have £800 worth of perfectly good medication (non-refrigerated) and my only option is, incredibly, to DISPOSE OF IT.
attributes.additional_details:
I contacted charities and IVF support groups and found that it’s actually illegal under the Medicines Act and the Drug trafficking Act to give them to someone else. 

IVF clinics or infertility charities should be allowed to redistribute the medication, helping families that cannot afford the drugs.

attributes.action: Ban large boats from passing through swing bridges at peak times.
attributes.background:
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic
3. Pollution - Every car passing the route will be sat in the same spot with the engine running for a good 20-30 minutes
attributes.additional_details:
Reasons why boats shouldn't be allowed to pass through swing bridges at peak times;
1. EVERYONE who goes through that route will or probably will be late for work or their appointments
2. Emergency services get blocked from entry by the large amounts of traffic. Dying? Tough - a boat needs to deliver a few boxes of car parts
3. Pollution - pretty much every car that is on its way home from work will be sat in the same spot with the engine running (unless it's stop start) for a good 20-30 minutes

attributes.action: A call for Highways England to make more sections of the M5 a smart motorway
attributes.background: Somerset Chamber of Commerce has long campaigned for better road infrastructure. The M5 is one of two main arterial routes into the South West. Frequently, the M5 between Gloucester and Exeter is affected by either full or partial closures affecting productivity, lost opportunity and serious injury.
attributes.additional_details: Following a freedom of information request to Highways England, it was confirmed that from 01/09/15 to 01/09/16 there were 16,934 incidents recorded on the M5 between Exeter & Gloucester, of which 3,547 resulted in full or partial closure, equating to an average of 10 accidents per day. The smart M42 motorway has resulted in no fatalities, reduced injury accidents by over 50%, and journey reliability improving by 22% since 2006, delivering major socio-economic benefits which could be replicated.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to burn state flags of all countries.
attributes.background: As we all know the UK is a very diverse and multicultural place especially London. For this reason, many people from different ethnics are united by flags that represent them. We must make it illegal to burn flags to decrease growing hate of different ethnics towards each other. eg Turks vs Kurds.
